definition: lit. if thrown on the floor, it will make a sound (idiom)/fig. (of one's words) powerful and resonating/to have substance
to toss/to throw dice/Taiwan pr. [zhi2]
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds

sentences.english: This is a bunch of different shades of footprints, but also a section of the Universal Declaration of sound.
sentences.chinese: 这是一串深浅不一的脚印，也是一段掷地有声的宣言。

sentences.english: I fell off my pink cloud with a thud.
sentences.chinese: 我从粉红色的云彩堕下，掷地有声。

sentences.english: His stirring words again show that China-Pakistan friendship is indeed deeper than the sea.
sentences.chinese: 这掷地有声的话语再次证明中巴友谊情比海深。

definition: lit. to chop the nail and slice the iron (idiom)/fig. resolute and decisive/unhesitating/categorical
lit. so loud that even the deaf can hear (idiom); rousing even the apathetic
impassioned/vehement
to speak forcibly out of a sense of righteousness (idiom)
concise and comprehensive (idiom)
unquestionable
words still ringing in one's ears (idiom)
bold, visionary words
devotion to righteousness that inspires reverence (idiom)
(of singing or speaking) very articulate pronunciation and vocalizing
lit. to draw blood on the first prick (idiom)/fig. to hit the nail on the head
to hit the target and do real damage (idiom)/fig. to hit where it hurts/fig. to hit home/an argument that hits the nail on the head
declaration/manifesto
magnificent/inspiring
earth-shattering/breakthrough/remarkable and original work
neither servile nor overbearing (idiom)/neither obsequious nor supercilious
